reviews.review_msg: His grading feels overly harsh. Even when I follow the rubric closely, it seems nearly impossible to earn a strong grade on discussion posts. On top of that, his feedback often comes across as condescending, which is really discouraging.

I had Bryan for INDG101, and he was great! I'm not sure where the bad reviews are coming from. In my opinion, Bryan is very knowledgeable and eager to help his students understand, providing them with lots of information about assignments and quizzes. If you do what is required of the course and ask questions when confused, you'll get a high grade.

Bryan does not seem to care about his students' learning. He's an unnecessarily harsh grader, focusing more on tiny details than concepts and course material. When communicating with him, his tone is dismissive and condescending. Before taking the course, multiple friends said they felt like Bryan "hated" them. I feel the same now. Stay away.

Took INDG201W online.  Avoid this class with Bryan if you can.  Class is (pretty much entirely) self-taught, the criteria are ambiguous, and the grading was procrastinated until the final weeks.  An outrageous amount of reading and writing (revising) is required.  Poorly organized and sloppy class.

(online class) Everything we covered I could have easily found on YouTube for free. We discussed many important topics at surface level there was no critical thinking needed. Initially I was looking forward to the discussion posts, but I felt strongly discouraged by the professors feedback. His recorded lectures aren't even him speaking

This course material was very important, but they were ridiculous about APA formatting.  Everything is marked very strictly for formatting.  Even if your work does exactly as required from the rubric, marks are deducted for style of writing.  They should be focused on if the student understood the material and message of this course.

one of the lowest effort courses i have ever taken. everything is graded from the quizzes and two non-cumulative midterms. wouldnt take it again only because this course felt like a joke to pay for and felt like a course that would be free online.

The overall course material was important, but the way it was taught didn't always match the values we were told to uphold (like compassion and relational accountability). Feedback was often vague, and at times felt passive aggressive unnecessarily critical.

Professor is known to be a very tough grader. Despite my best efforts, I've struggled to get 50% on discussion posts. One week, his feedback was that I didn't stay on topic, the next week he said I needed to make more personal connections. Review criteria every time I submit plus, yet I'm still unclear on what exactly he's looking for

Good reviews are clearly from Bryan. You can tell from the stark difference in the reviews: either extremely positive or negative. Brian is obsessed with control. I want to steer people clear of this guy. I once commented that we should have more First Nations teaching indigenous courses, and that pissed him off. Just to give you an idea of him

All online, impossible to get a hold of. Bit of an ass when it comes to grading. Unclear instructions and expects you to know exactly what he wants. Would never take again even tho I did alright. Caused sooooooo much stress.
I did ING201 online. Lots of weekly readings, unclear expectations for group discussions, took too long to reply to public discussion board, HARD marker, and lowkey condescending.
Professional, funny, concise, clear, and deeply respectful of the course material.
marked way too hard for a first year, intro course
Super boring snoozefest! Avoid at all costs. The class was generally easy, but it did not have to be 3 hours long. Plus the TA's suck!

Stuck in a farcical course with a prof obsessed with control. Group work is a myth, lectures a snoozefest filled with documentaries. Attendance "optional," yet vital quizzes, worth 45% of our grade, force our hand. It's manipulation, not education. A complete mockery of learning. Disgraceful.

Prof Myles is so easy! He literally does not give any exams and everything is so easy, definitely a gpa booster. I do think he is not the greatest prof though honestly, he does not really seem too interested in teaching and the format of his class was not engaging at all.
Good professor. Make sure you read the feedback as this helped me receive a better grade. Readings aren't to long except they can get boring sometimes. Really easy to talk to.

I am enjoying my INDG101 course with him and his current TA. They give excellent feedback and the course materials are relevant and not too dense. It's definitely a good course as a first year student. It is teaching me useful skills like how to write concisely and manage weekly assignment. Marking is fair. Would take again!

Bryan is a great prof! He's very caring & gets to know his students. He is passionate about what he teaches. This course is quiz heavy but the quizzes are not hard if you attend lectures and do the readings. The assignments are aimed at helping you succeed. Textbook is incredibly dry. But Bryans lectures are great so it makes up for it!

We had weekly quizzes (which were easy as long as you paid attention) and participation definitely matters. The only other assignment that counted towards the final grade was a research paper. It was very open-ended so you could pick any topic within Indigenous studies so you could really explore what you wanted. Definitely recommend this class!

Bryan is a great prof! I feel that indg101 should be a mandatory class because it's so important to learn about the history of Canada. there are weekly readings that don't take too long to do and weekly quizzes about the readings. each quiz was fair and easy to do as long as you do the readings! no final exams just a final research paper.

Loved the prof himself and his teaching, but his grading style and outlines are very ambiguous making it difficult for some of the assignments. There were weekly quizzes that were quite easy and participation definitely matters, but the TAs and Bryan did well creating a friendly open environment for discussion. Great prof overall!

Bryan is a really great prof, and he teaches this very important course well! He is kind and approachable, marking is fair, and assignments are clear. He is a great prof to have if you are in your first year.

probably the best class ive taken so far. bryan is a super approachable prof and is very generous with his grading. weekly quizzes are a breeze especially if you at least skim through the readings. paper is super open ended too so you can write about whatever interests you. highly recommend this class!

professor myles is great! indg101 (formally known as fnst101) is such an important class to take, you learn alot of valuable information. his quizzes are fair, if you watched the lecture and skimmed the readings, you will get all of the questions correct! he is also a fair grader
Good prof, hes funny and clearly is passionate about first nations. Exams were fair and werent hard as long as you understand the slides!
Nice professor, fair marking, and caring. Interesting lectures as well

This would have been an easy A if I actually studied. Lectures were enriched with documentaries he chose to include. I realized so many issues around Indigenous people and communities because of him and this course. I find him a little awkward, but he's a kind person(maybe bc first time professor?)! if possible, do take FNST101 before you graduate!
First semester ever teaching a course and he has done a great job. Very kind and approachable. Is not intimidating at all and is a fair marker. Exams are fair too.
